definitions.definition: To draw in the breath suddenly , as if from a shock .
examples: The audience gasped as the magician disappeared.

definitions.definition: To breathe quickly or in a labored manner, as after exertion ; to respire with heaving of the breast ; to pant .
examples: We were all gasping when we reached the summit.

definitions.definition: To speak in a breathless manner.
examples: The old man gasped his last few words.

definitions.definition: To pant with eagerness or excitement ; to show vehement desire.
examples: I'm gasping for a cup of tea.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To draw in the breath suddenly , as if from a shock .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To breathe quickly or in a labored manner, as after exertion ; to respire with heaving of the breast ; to pant .
( transitive ) To speak in a breathless manner.
To pant with eagerness or excitement ; to show vehement desire.
